alert.note: Alert for Jim Wells; Kleberg; Nueces (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Corpus Christi (Corpus Cristi, Victoria and Laredo)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 14 at 11:05AM CDT by NWS Corpus Christi
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 145 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of south Texas, including the following counties, Jim Wells, Kleberg and Nueces. * WHEN...Until 145 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1105 AM CDT, the public reported heavy rain in the advisory area. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Between 2 and 6 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Kingsville, Premont, Driscoll, Bishop, Kingsville Naval Air Station, Ricardo, Riviera, Riviera Beach, La Gloria, Petronila, Loyola Beach and Chapman Ranch. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
